artists.name: Nelson Rockwood
artists.title: General Contractor
artists.blurb: I was introduced to Joey by the interior designer to paint and do a couple of tile installations. Joey and I connected on a lot of levels and the requests to take the house in a whole new direction got bigger and bolder with every visit. I'm a rare fit for this. I might be one of a few GC's with a theater degree and a desire to work creatively on this level. My role became almost equal parts general contractor and art curator. Ann introduced some incredible talent to the project: Mishka, graphic designer, Aaron, muralist, and Evan, neon and sheetmetal artist and I had the pleasure of finding other talent: Jim, stained glass, Dan, water features, Pyrology, bronze sculpture and Stuart, stone sculptor, Craig and Teena, front door, to name a few. I loved bringing good people to this project because it was a rare one for all of us. We were empowered at every turn with great creative license and I feel that really got us excited. I always try to engender the care in every craftsman. To have a client that was so fully supportive of everyone's work was really amazing. Joey could not have been more excited about the work and that inspired everyone to their best.     What this experience has meant to me...  I believe it's taught me, as a young business owner, that the right clients are out there. I might only ever get to work with one Joey, but it has been encouraging to me to know that my specific skillset and my desire to blend art and construction, has a place. It has been a honor and pleasure to be tasked with finding artists and craftsman to translate visions into reality.  It has been rewarding to take great care in ensuring that all of the elements come together beautifully and to know that the client is rooting for us throughout the process.  As I write this, I can't help but think about how much more is still to be done! :)   I have also personally learned a lot from Joey's disposition.  He always has something positive to say. His enthusiasm is contagious and he doesn't sweat the small stuff. The only time he got mad (so he claims) was when we locked him out of the house. I never saw him mad because he chose to take a drive and came back smiling (to an unlocked house, thank goodness). He also really seems to enjoy people. He loved talking to Aaron while he was painting the mural. He's met and talked with all of the artists on the project.  He and Evan went guitar shopping. He's always glad to see Leo, our painter on site. All of this reminds me to take the time to visit with people, and to choose to see the good in the world. Those are pretty incredible lessons to take away from a client in the middle of a home renovation.

artists.name: Ann Tucker
artists.title: Interior Designer
artists.blurb: During our first meetings with Joey, he expressed a strong desire to create a house that would be a gathering place for his family, neighbors, and the community. However, the original form of the spec house was closed, even hostile towards the street. I had a hunch that landscaping and a standard re-paint wouldn't be the cure needed. Assembling the team of builders, designers, and craftspeople to collaborate on the transformation of the house from spec to an underwater fantasy was great fun! Each new person brought onto the team caught the infectious joy of the project! We all could feel the FUN and WONDER radiating from the house onto the street to every passerby.

artists.name: Mishka Westell
artists.title: Mural Designer
artists.blurb: It was wonderful to work with someone as imaginative and adventurous as Joey who let us all push the boundaries and create something truly unique and joyous, and turn his home into a work of art.

artists.title: Metal Forgers
artists.blurb: It was wonderful to work with someone as imaginative and adventurous as Joey who let us all push the boundaries and create something truly unique and joyous, and turn his home into a work of art.

artists.name: Daniel Hornung
artists.title: Glass Sculptor
artists.blurb: This project was a rare opportunity to work a sea horse into a sculpture design and have it make sense.

artists.name: Jim Berry
artists.title: Glass Worker
artists.blurb: It was just such a unique project. Nelson and Joey were both fun to work with. Matching up our stained glass tentacle to the outside mural was challenging with several trips to template the window. It was all worth the effort on installation day when everything matched up. Then doing the front door stained glass was equally gratifying.

artists.name: Heidi Choate
artists.title: Landscaper
artists.blurb: Working with so many other talented and exceptionally creative individuals was a unique and special experience. Getting to know Joey, someone I can consider a friend now, has been an experience all on its own. His 'down for anything' attitude and laid back nature made this experience truly a pleasure. There were no boundaries with him when it came to a creative idea to take this house to the next level.   When Joey contacted Rain Lily for a consultation and I walked through his brand new spec home that felt practically sterile, I had no idea what this project would evolve into and that we would end up working together for almost two years. I know there is more to come, can't wait for phase 3 and beyond!

artists.name: Dan
artists.title: Water Feature Designer
artists.blurb: The Octopus House is literally a piece of art and absolutely represents 'keeping it weird' in Austin TX. As local artists, we loved contributing to what makes our city so special. It was easy to visualize the water features under the giant blue octopus and a view of the creek. We had the opportunity to use unique materials, so we tucked quartz crystals and moss into the waterfalls and even added a giant floating quartz as a focal point to the backyard stream! It was amazing to connect not only to the space, but as water artisans with other artists and craftspeople.

artists.name: Craig and Teena
artists.title: Wood Carvers
artists.blurb: I think it's every custom manufacturer's desire to work on fun project that requires a step outside the box. This project allowed us to re-ignite our creative thinking and to exhibit our talents as a custom door manufacturer. It took a conjoint effort within our team and the ingenuity of other trades to create the final work of art, but each individual involved was able to take home a little extra pride knowing they were a puzzle piece in the making of an extraordinary home that will be talked about for years to come.

artists.name: Stuart Simpson
artists.title: Stone Sculptor
artists.blurb: This has been such a wonderful project to be a part of. Joey has been an absolute delight to work with, and has encouraged me from the get-go to use my artistic license, and have fun with the project, which in return has allowed me to fabricate something truly special. Nelson has also been a solid team member to collaborate with throughout the process. This is exactly the type of work I love to do and I am so grateful for this opportunity!

artifacts.name: THE FACE
artifacts.blurb: A beautiful combination of paint, stain glass, architecture and engineering sets this house apart from all others.

artifacts.name: THE MERMAID
artifacts.blurb: This stunning eye catcher is forged from bronze and brings a delicateness to a strong metal!

artifacts.name: THE DOOR
artifacts.blurb: The entrance to this house is a collaboration of carved African Mahogany with gorgeous stain glass.

artifacts.name: THE GLASS
artifacts.blurb: The stain glass breathes life into the house as it brings an array of glowing colors from the sunlight.

artifacts.name: NEON SEAHORSE
artifacts.blurb: This bright guy brings a certain excitement and flare to the house.

artifacts.name: EYES OF TEXAS
artifacts.blurb: What better way to represent your Texas roots than with this phenomenal beaded Longhorn skull?

artifacts.name: SACRED SPACE
artifacts.blurb: This awe inspiring piece of 19,000 beads brings a serenity to the space.

artifacts.name: MOTHER NATURE
artifacts.blurb: This Goddess is carved from 3 blocks of Texas limestone and embedded with crystals and plants.

artifacts.name: THE TILING
artifacts.blurb: This stunning tile from Morrocco reallyties the room together.

artifacts.name: THE LIGHTS
artifacts.blurb: One of the most integral parts of this house is the lighting, which sets the tone.  Party mode anybody?

artifacts.name: THE BOOKSHELF
artifacts.blurb: Not every house has a sexy built in bookshelf designed specifically for the room.

artifacts.name: THE BRAIN
artifacts.blurb: Not many people can take on crazy ideas and make them a beautiful and unique reality.

artifacts.name: THE STYLIST
artifacts.blurb: It takes a special person to explore out of this world ideas and bring them together in a cohesive manner.

artifacts.name: THE GARDENERS
artifacts.blurb: It takes 2 gardeners to tend to this unique octopus garden.

artifacts.name: THE NINJA PAINTER
artifacts.blurb: Need your interior and exterior meticulously painted?  It's even better when you don't even notice them!
